audio_sermons.title: (2 Peter) HIM
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Willie Mullan (1911 - 1980)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Willie Mullan in mp3 format. Was a Northern Irish Evangelist. He was born in Newtownards, County Down, Ireland in 1911. In his book Tramp after God, he tells of living for more than three years as a tramp abusing alcohol and involved in crime. Willie Mullan had a religious conversion and from that time forward he decided he would strive to serve God.

 In 1953 Willie Mullan was called to Lurgan Baptist church, and in August of that year he commenced the work in Lurgan. One of his great accomplishments during this time was the Tuesday night Bible class. Every Tuesday night hundreds attended to hear the exposition of the Word. In 1957 William Hewitt and a team of helpers commenced the tape recordings of the Bible class. At least 1500 of these recordings remain until this day.

audio_sermons.title: (Following The Footsteps Of Christ) The Mount Of Transfiguration
audio_sermons.description: "First you get occupied with the Person," teaches Willie Mullan, "then you get occupied with the power."  The message weaves the historical background of this great event in the life of the Lord Jesus and what it means for His followers today.  Is Jesus only in our lives, in our home, in our church?

audio_sermons.title: (Through The Bible) 2 Peter 1-3
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Chuck Smith (1927 - 2013)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Chuck Smith in mp3 format. Pastor Chuck was used in the Jesus People revival where he was used along with others to minister to the hippy young people. They saw a work of the Spirit where many were added to the church and discipled. He has raised up many pastors who are a part of the Calvary Chapel movement now and where he pastors the large Costa Mesa church in California.

The Calvary Chapel movement is based of simple principles that Chuck Smith taught over the years such as: The priority of agape love, Simple fellowship amongst the saints, the breaking of bread, the teaching of God's word chapter by chapter and verse by verse. And lastly and most importantly the principle not by might nor by power but by my spirit saith the Lord.

audio_sermons.title: 2 Peter 1
audio_sermons.description: "Precious faith lays hold upon precious promises," says Robert Adcock.  "I can become something for God that I never was before."  Exhortation and encouragement from this chapter point us to God's Word where we find spiritual growth, faith and revelation.

audio_sermons.title: 24. How doth Christ execute the office of a prophet?
A Faith Never Forgotten
audio_sermons.description: Human life was meant to be lived by drawing on the resources of God. According to David Roper, only God can live a human life! When man fell, he tried to live on a human level. But he quickly discovered that living such a life was impossible. In order to really live, he needed God.

audio_sermons.title: Bristol Conference 1964 (Apostasy) - Part 1
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
William MacDonald (1917 - 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker William MacDonald in mp3 format. Was President of Emmaus Bible College, teacher, Plymouth Brethren theologian and a prolific author of over 84 published books. MacDonald refused to accept royalties for his books but established a fund for translating his work Believers Bible Commentary into foreign languages.

   Bill will be not only be remembered for the thousands upon thousands of lives he touched through his books, teaching and many personal letters, but for his Christ-like character and gentleness, yet powerful life lived by faith in Christ. One of his most impact-ful books is the small booklet called: "True Discipleship" it is recommended reading for every serious disciple of Christ.

audio_sermons.title: Life of Elijah - Part 5
audio_sermons.description: This Elijah series is an excellent study on the life of Elijah. We see the blessings from his obedience and the results of his disobedience.  A perfect example for each of us to apply to our daily lives.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Major Ian Thomas (1914 – 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Major Ian Thomas in mp3 format. Evangelical writer, theological teacher and founder of the Torchbearers bible schools. These schools are now world-wide in many countries and provide a teaching base on the person of Christ in the believer and basic Biblical exposition of Bible books.

Among the many books that he wrote, the most influential have been: "The Saving Life Of Christ" , "The mystery of godliness" and "If I perish, I Perish." His burden in ministry was to express and show the indwelling life of Christ in believers and the rest and power that life will have in us as we trust and have faith.

audio_sermons.title: Making The Testimony Of Jesus Our Testimony
audio_sermons.description: Stephen shares about how our testimony is different from the testimony of Jesus and the one thing that must be done if the testimony of Jesus is to become our testimony.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Stephen Kaung ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Stephen Kaung in mp3 format. Stephen Kaung is a Chinese Chrisitan speaker and writer, and now living in Richmond, Virgina. At an early age was converted to Christianity and was active in the Methodist Church in China, with home his father was a minister. He first met watchman need in the early 1930's and joined Nee's indigenous christian work full-time, working with him until 1949 when he left China and became involved with Christian work in other ares of the Far East.

Stephen Kaung worked very closely with T Austin-Sparks until his death in 1972. His burden has been to allow a testimony of the Lord in the local assembly, and to help the saints see the great importance of the Church as God intended it. Stephen Kaung's major work has been to translate the writings of Watchman Nee into English, over 50 titles which have been published by his own organisation, Christian Fellowship Publishers (CFP), In Richmond, Virgina.

audio_sermons.title: Men Whose Eyes Have Seen The King - Part 1
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
T. Austin Sparks (1888 â€“ 1971)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker T. Austin Sparks in mp3 format. He was ordained as a Baptist pastor at the age of 24, and from 1912 to 1926 led three congregations in Greater London. During these years, he was also closely related to Jessie Penn-Lewis and her publication and speaking ministry, the "Overcomer Testimony."

Among the many books that he wrote, at least three are regarded as Christian classics: The School of Christ, The Centrality and Supremacy of the Lord Jesus Christ and We Beheld His Glory. The primary theme of Sparks' books is the exaltation of the Lord Jesus Christ. He mentored Watchman Nee for many years and was very influential in his understanding of the Church Life.

audio_sermons.description: This message was preached at the Anaheim Vineyard during the Revival Fire Conference in 1991.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Leonard Ravenhill (1907 Â– 1994)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Leonard Ravenhill in mp3 format. A revivalist and man of God who sought God's will above all else. He was a man of prayer who practiced what he preached. He wrote the book: 'Why Revival Tarries' which has become a classic on revival. His prophetic edge and burden made him to be respected by some and disliked by others. Yet he stayed true to God's call on his life prayed and pleading for true heaven sent revival. 

"Those who know of Leonard Ravenhill recognize in him the religious specialist, the man sent from God to battle the priests of Baal on their own mountain top, to shame the careless priest at the altar, to face the false prophet, and to warn the people who are being led astray by him. " - Tozer | "Leonard Ravenhill was one of the few men I have ever known who was a true prophet." - David Wilkerson

audio_sermons.title: Receiving The Holy Spirit
audio_sermons.description: August 1, 2004 - God had a plan that you and I would not only survive but that we would be more than over comers. It doesn’t matter how wicked the world becomes and what the devil brings on society – we have abiding in us a power that is greater than any other power. This power is the Holy Spirit!! You have not fully received the Holy Spirit until you allow Him to do what He was sent to do. We are to cast every burden on Him –HE is the Burden Bearer. As we turn every burden over to Him – We are receiving Him.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
David Wilkerson (1931 – 2011)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker David Wilkerson in mp3 format. Founder of Times Square Church in New York City with over 100 different languages spoken in the congregation. Wilkerson wrote many powerful books such as: The Vision and Cross and the Switchblade. His ministry was prophetic as God called him to be a watchman to the Church in North America. He gave clear messages on repentance to the Church. 

Wilkerson also founded Teen Challenge where there are hundreds of centres for Christ-centered drug recovery and addiction recovery. He also organized and spoke at pastors gatherings in many countries where he gave prophetic strong messages to encourage pastors and leaders.

audio_sermons.title: The Development of Character
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Paris Reidhead (1919 - 1992)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Paris Reidhead in mp3 format. Was a Christian missionary, teacher, writer, and advocate of economic development in impoverished nations. A spiritual crisis during this period—as he described two decades later in what is probably his best-known recorded teaching, "Ten Shekels and a Shirt"--left Reidhead with the conviction that much of evangelicalism had adopted utilitarian and humanistic philosophies contradictory to Biblical teaching. The end of all being, he came to believe, was not the happiness of man, but the glorification of God. This theme would recur throughout his later teaching.

Since Mr. Reidhead's death in 1992, Bible Teaching Ministries, Inc. continues under the leadership of his wife, Marjorie, and daughter, Virginia Teitt, a dedicated Board, and the many people who have donated time and talent after being changed by God’s Word through this message. The message of the Gospel is reaching an ever-widening audience all over the world.

audio_sermons.title: The Power Of The Spirit In The Early Church by Sandeep Poonen
audio_sermons.description: Brother Sandeep Poonen shares on New Covenant Christianity, the freedom in this covenant and the difference between keeping rules and regulations. He moves on to speak of how the work and ministry of the Holy Spirit was in the early church and spoke of persecution and the need for boldness with the power of the Holy Spirit.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
SermonIndex.net Simulcast Conference
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons of the SermonIndex.net Simulcast Event 2012 in mp3 format. There has been much prayer and support in the west for those precious saints who suffer for Jesus in restricted and closed nations. Now some choice servants are saying persecution will be coming upon the Church in North America. We are anything but prepared. This simulcast event is geared to warn and help the Church in North America start the process of being ready for persecution.

All speakers have come freely on their own accord not recieving any honorium. The event is 100% free. SermonIndex does not recieve any money from the event. The First Baptist Church is hosting us freely. We believe that this event is an expression of the body of Christ coming together in this critical time. Our desire is simply to see the body of Christ strengthened through this event.

audio_sermons.title: The Revelation Of Christ Within Scripture
audio_sermons.description: Ed Miller is teaching at his finest from the vantage point of Jesus on the Mount of Transfiguration and what that means practically of seeing Christ in Scripture.  “Everything you need,” he assures, “is by seeing Christ.  You don’t need more surrender; you need a larger revelation of Christ.  If you surrender to one horsepower, you’re going to do a lot of pushing.”

audio_sermons.title: The Timelessness of God
audio_sermons.description: The Major shares powerfully the timeless character of God and how it effects our concept and understand and knowing of God in our lifes. He touches on many principles that will make you re-think what you have accepted as true.

audio_sermons.title: Why I Choose to Believe the Bible
audio_sermons.description: Most Christians can be backed into a corner with two or three questions. Ask them what they believe about any subject, then ask them why they believe what they believe. By this point you'll have them where you want them since they would likely have said they believe what they believe because the Bible says so. Now comes the third and final question... Why do you choose to believe the Bible? At this point you will either get stammering and stuttering, or something worse.
